title: San Diego Padres pitcher Jacob Nix arrested after breaking into Arizona home through DOGGIE DOOR
text:
San Diego Padres pitcher Jacob Nix has been arrested for breaking into an Arizona home through the doggie door, leading the homeowner to kick him in the face and attack him with a Taser.

The 23-year-old pitcher, from California, was arrested and charged with criminal trespassing for breaking into a residence in Peoria, Arizona on October 6.

At about 3.30am Nix entered a home near 91st Avenue and Beardsley Road through the doggie door. It's not clear why he was trying to enter the home.

The unidentified homeowner then confronted Nix and kicked him in the face.

San Diego Padres pitcher Jacob Nix, 23, (left in mugshot, right in uniform) was arrested and charged with criminal trespassing for breaking into an Arizona home on October 6

Cops said another man, 23-year-old Thomas Cosgrove - who plays for the Padres' minor league team the Lake Elsinore Storm - then reached through the doggie door to pull Nix out of the home and the two tried to flee, according to ABC15.

Thomas Cosgrove, 23, - who plays for the Padres' minor league team the Lake Elsinore Storm - was also arrested in the incident

But as they tried to run the homeowner leaned out of the doggie door and deployed his Taser, hitting Nix in the back, according to court records.

The homeowner called police and cops found and arrested the pair a few streets away.

The San Diego Padres released a statement in light of the incident.

'We are aware of the alleged incident involving Jacob Nix last Sunday in Arizona,' the Padres said in a statement.

'We take this matter seriously and have been in contact with the Commissioner's Office and local authorities. Due to ongoing legal proceedings, we will not have any further comment at this time.'

The duo had tried to enter a home in Peoria, Arizona near 91st Avenue and Beardsley Road

Nix is currently in Arizona assigned to the Peoria Javelinas in the Arizona Fall League team

Nix was drafted by the Padres in 2015 and spent five seasons with the team.

He pitched nine games for the Padres in 2018 but was injured most of last season, according to MLB.com.

He was supposed to play for the team again this year but tore his UCL in his elbow and has been undergoing plasma treatments and rehabilitation and pitched six games in the minor league this season.

He's currently in the Arizona Fall League, an off season league, where he's working to get back in shape for baseball season pitching for the Peoria Javelinas, according to Yahoo.

Cosgrove was drafted by the Padres in 2017 and pitches for the teams minor league team.
description: San Diego Padres pitcher Jacob Nix, 23, was arrested and charged with criminal trespassing for breaking into an Arizona home on October 6.
